14.heading: Zimmerman, David, 1970-
14.title: Comic Book Character : Unleashing the Hero in Us All
14.author: David A

contents.title: Let the weak say "I am strong" : Spider-man, Superman & the Incredible Hulk
Vengeance is mine : Batman, the Joker & the Punisher
X-cursus : heroes in the hands of a professional
You cannot see my face : costumes & secret identities
Everyone was beautiful & nothing hurt : body image, agelessness, death
God loves, man kills : gender, race & the X-Men
My country 'tis of thee : Captain America & the truth
Might makes right : the Justice League meets the Avengers
Gods walk the earth : demi-gods, Daredevil & the problem of religion
Evil is as evil does : Lex Luthor, Magneto & Galactus
Holy case study! Superman versus Jesus
Appendix: How to read a comic book.

notes: Book on superhero comic books and Christian ethics.

17.heading: Zimmerman, Dwight Jon.
17.title: Gulf War Journal : a Graphic Novel
17.author: Don Lomax, story and pencil art ; Rose Lomax, inks ; Clem Robins, lettering ; Burton Moore, front cover ; Don Lomax, back cover ; Hilary Hughes, Dwight Jon Zimmerman, editors.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Scott "Journal" Neithammer comes out of retirement to cover the first Persian Gulf War. He finds himself also caught up in the war between the Pentagon and the press! Fed up with press restrictions, he heads off into the desert on his own and gets an unwelcome firsthand taste of the full fury of modern American firepower. Contains an all-new story about the Second Persian Gulf War and the tragic cost Operation Iraqi Freedom has for Scott Neithammer.

28.heading: Zimmerman, Dwight Jon.
28.title: Steve McQueen : Full-Throttle Cool
28.author: written by Dwight Jon Zimmerman ; art by Greg Scott.
notes: star of films such as Bullitt, The Great Escape, The Thomas Crown Affair, and Papillon

lived as large off screen as on. An actor, motorcycle and automobile racer, and all-around gearhead, McQueen rose from hardscrabble circumstances to become one of the most famous movie stars in the world. Steve McQueen: Full-Throttle Cool presents McQueen's life story in graphic biography format, from the early years that included a stint in reform school to his death from mesothelioma."

101.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Amazing Adventures. Volume 1
101.author: stories by Landry Q
101.appears_in: Walker, et al. ; art by Chad Thomas, et al. ; colors by Heather Breckel ; letters by Shawn Lee.
notes: "Originally published as Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Amazing Adventures issues #1-4."

102.heading: The Zine Antidote.
102.title: Eniz : the Zine Antidote
102.author: by Ken Dahl.
notes: - Summary (from Optical Sloth): "Eniz (the zine antidote) should be required reading for anybody who makes a mini, as it makes all sorts of important points about making comics, how they've been co-opted and all the talented people have fled to the internet (although I like to think a number of them have come back since this strip came out), but why the hell not make them anyway?"

104.title: Zine Design : Intro Tips for Comic Zines
104.author: Rayne Klar.
notes: Summary (from atomicbooks.com): "Zine Design is Rayne Klar's intro to making comic zines, done in fully illustrated comic format. Friendly, easy to use, and very well-drawn, Klar's guide teaches about drafting, character design, settings, drawing perspective, as well as paneling and framing."

110.heading: Zines.
110.title: The Last Turnaround
110.author: Clutch McBastard.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Clutch McBastard's comics journal. In this issue, Clutch considers buying a house, staffs a table at the Portland Zine Symposium, makes zines, rides his bike, and more.

111.heading: Zines.
111.title: The Lost Years
111.author: Clutch McBastard.
notes: "Portions of this book originally appeared in the Invincible Summer/Clutch spilt [sic] zines."

Summary (from OCLC): Clutch McBastard details the travails and triumphs of his life through four-panel journal comics. Clutch and his friends create zines, comics, records and good times. This issue celebrates riding bikes, karaoke, dancing at shows, Blazer basketball games, movies and weather. He even shares the simple pleasures that are out of reach for busy folks: naps.
